alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:21PM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pequannock River Below Macopin Dam affecting Passaic and Morris Counties. For the Pequannock River...including Macopin Dam...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pequannock River below Macopin Dam. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Road closures begin in both Butler and Bloomingdale due to flooding. At 6.5 feet, Both Main Streets in Butler and Bloomingdale flood. Several commercial properties are also flooded. The Hamburg Turnpike experiences significant flooding. Flooding expands to the east side of Bloomingdale. Sloan Park is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:55 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 5.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tonight to a crest of 6.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 04/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Pequannock River Macopin Dam 5.5 5.4 Tue 10 p 6.2 5.5 6.4 1pm 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1130 AM EST.
